Badusha Recipe

Maida – 1 and 1/2 cups
Butter(at room temperature) – 1/4 cup
Oil – 1.5 tbsp
Curd – 2 tbsp
Cooking Soda – 1/2 tsp
Sugar – 1 tsp
Water – 1/4 cup(+ or – adjust accordingly)
Oil – as required for deep frying
FOR THE SUGAR SYRUP:
Sugar- 1/2 cup
Water – 3/4 cup
Elachi powder – a generous pinch
Saffron – 2 strands
Lemon Juice – 3/4 tsp

1) In a mixing bowl add melted butter, curd, oil, cooking soda, sugar and mix it well. Now add maida and mix the texture will be like crumbels, then add water to make dough (like chapati dough) and keep it a side for half hour.
2) After half an hour make small balls (small lemon size) and using your thumb press in the middle.
3) In a pan add sugar and water and give it a boin till you get single string consistancy then add saffron strands, elachi powder and lemon juice(this is to avoid crystallisation), keep aside.
4) Simultaneously while making the sugar syrup itself you can start frying the badusha.Drain it in tissue then add it to the prepared sugar syrup immediately. Dip well on both sides, keep immersed for 2mins then transfer it to a serving tray and garnish with some thin chopped pintasho.
NOTE: To get a perfect badusha we should fry them in a very low flame/heat.

granulated sugar - 1/2 cup
rose water - 1 Tea Spoon

Ground nutme
saffron - Few threads

Pumpkin - 2 cups
Sugar - 3 cups
Oil - 1 cup
Eggs - 3
Maida - 3 cups
Salt - 1/2 Tea Spoon
Baking Powder - 1/2 Tea Spoon
Baking Soda - 1 Tea Spoon
Cloves Powder - 1 Tea Spoon
Cinnamon Powder - 1 Tea Spoon
Nutmeg Powder - 1 Tea Spoon

1. Add pumpkin, sugar, oil and eggs in a blender and blend well.
2. Take a bowl and add flour, salt and baking powder and baking soda.
3. Now mix the blended pumpkin and egg mixture to the dry ingredients and mix well.
4. Pour the mixture in a wax paper lined 8″ pan.
5. Bake the pan in a preheated oven at 350F for 1 hour and fifteen minute.
6. When done take it out with the help of a knife and dust with powdered sugar
Banana Burfi

Large ripe banana - 4
Milk - 11/2 cup
Sugar - 2 cups
Ghee - 2 Table Spoons
Coconut - ¼ cup
Crushed walnut - 1/2 cup

1. Remove the outer skin of banana and mash them.
2. Now cook mashed banana along with milk in a pan until milk dries up.
3. Now add butter and stir continuously till it turns brown in color.
4. Now add sugar, grated coconut and walnut and stir.
5. Remove it from the flame. Grease a plate with butter and spread the mixture in the plate.
6. Its thickness should be 1/2”. When it settles to be cut in pieces, cut burfi in desired shape.
7. Garnish with dry fruits
8. Take in to serving bowl and serve
Mango Cream

Mango puree - 2 cups
Lime juice - 1 Table Spoon
Heavy cream - 1 cup
Unflavored gelatin - 1 Table Spoon
Honey - 2 Table Spoons

1. Sprinkle the gelatin on 1/3 cup cold water, then dissolve, stirring, over low heat.
2. Let it cool for some time.
3. Mix the mango puree, honey , lime juice and gelatin.
4. Whip the cream until stiff , then fold lightly but completely into the mango mixture.
5. Pour into a mold, rinsed out with cold water.
6. Refrigerate until set and then serve.
Mango Sherbet

Lemon juice - 1 Table Spoon
Mangoes - 2 ( pureed and strained )
Egg white - 1
Sugar - 3/4 cup
Cream - 3 Table Spoon ( whipped)

1. Take a heavy based sauce pot and put sugar and 1¼ cup water in it and stir to dissolve.
2. Boil for 5-6 minutes.
3. Remove from heat; stir in lemon juice and let cool.
4. Stir mango puree into syrup and pour out into a shallow metal container.
5. Cover the mixture and freeze it
6. Turn semi-frozen mixture into a round dish and cream well.
7. Return the mixture to the container, cover and freeze until just becoming slushy again.
8. Turn out into the round dish and cream well.
9. Take a separate bowl, whip egg white until stiff but not dry.
10. Fold cream and then the egg white into the mango mixture, spoon back into the container, cover and freeze until firm.
11. About 30 minutes before serving, transfer the sherbet to the refrigerator.
Fruit Kheer

Bananas - 2 (peeled and thinly sliced)
Oranges - 2 (peeled into segments with pipe removed)
Saffron strands - 1/2 Tea Spoon
Sugar - 2 Tea Spoon
Black pepper powder - 1/2 Tea Spoon
Red chili powder - 1/2 Tea Spoon
Salt - 1 Tea Spoon
Curd - 1 cup

1. Tak a bowl and m ix the sugar, pepper and chili powder, salt and curd together.
2. Add the bananas and oranges and mix together for 2 minutes.
3. Dissolve the saffron in a tsp of water and sprinkle it over the dish before serving.
4. Now the tasty fruit pudding is ready to serve.
Straw Berry Ice Cream

Fresh strawberries - 2 cups
Sugar - 200 Grams (split into 2 equal halves)
Egg yolks - 3 (beaten)
Full cream milk - 250ml
double cream - 500ml
vanilla extract - 1 Tea Spoon

1. De-stalk, wash and chop the strawberries into small pieces.
2. Place in a mixing bowl and add 100 Grams of sugar to it.
3. Mash well until you have a smooth mixture. Chill the mixture in the refrigerator.
4. Mix together the egg yolks, the remaining 100 Grams of sugar
5. Beat until smooth. Pour the milk into a saucepan and heat gently on a medium heat until hot
6. Mix well. Pour the mixture back into the saucepan and heat gently, stirring frequently
7. Do not bring to the boil. After several minutes it will start to thicken into a custard.
8. remove the pan from the heat and leave the mixture to cool.
9. When the custard has cooled, transfer into a chilled bowl.
10. refrigerate the mix for at least 3 hours
11. When the custard is thoroughly chilled, pour the double cream into a separate mixing bowl and whip until slightly fluffy.
12. Stir the whipped cream into the chilled custard mixture. Stir into this the vanilla extract.
13. The mixture is now ready to transfer to the ice cream maker and freeze
Mango Pudding

Fresh Milk - 400 ml
Ice Water - 250 ml
Whipping cream - 250 Grams
Gelatine Powder - 40 Grams
Mango Puree - 300 Grams
Water - 300 ml
Butter - 20 Grams
Coconut Powder - 1 Table Spoon
Sugar - 200 Grams

1. Mix gelatin powder, sugar and water, stir well and bring to boil till sugar dissolves in water.
2. Add in grease keep aside.
3. Stir and mix well mango puree, ice water, milk, whipping cream and instant coconut powder.
4. Mix the sugar solution and puree, stir well.
5. Pour the mixture into a desired shape mould.
6. Chill well and serve
Semolina/suji and Banana Pudding

Clarified butter (ghee) - 1 cup
Semolina - 2 cups (suji Rawa/Upma Ravva)
Milk - 4 cups
Sugar - 1 cup
Ripe bananas - 4 (cut in fine roundels)

1. Heat the clarified butter (ghee) in a pan and roast the semolina on low heat stirring continuously for about 3 minutes or till the raw smell is gone and it gives a nice aroma.\n2. Add the milk and sugar. Stir well. Add the banana roundels and mix well. Keep stirring on very low heat for about 3 minutes or till all the moisture has evaporated
Gulab Jamuns

Carnation Milk Powder - 1 cup
All purpose flour - 1/2 cup
Baking soda - 1/2 Tea Spoon
Butter -melted - 2 tablespoons
Whole milk - just enough to make the dough
FOR THE SUGAR SYRUP :
Sugar - 2 cups
water - 1 cup
Ghee - for frying

1. Make the dough by combining the milk powder, butter.
2. Add just enough whole milk to make medium-hard dough.
3. Divide the dough into 18-20 portions.
4. Make balls by gently rolling each portion between your palms into a smooth ball.
5. Place the balls on a plate. Cover with a damp yet dry kitchen towel.
6. Heat the ghee on high and then lower the heat to medium.
7. Slip in the balls into the hot ghee from the side of the pan, one by one.
8. They will sink to the bottom of the pan, but do not try to move them.
9. Instead, gently shake the pan to keep the balls from browning on just one side.
10. After about 5 minutes, the balls will rise to the surface.
11. The Gulab Jamuns should rise slowly to the top if the temperature is just right
12. Now they must be gently and constantly agitated to ensure even browning on all sides.
13. If the temperature of the oil is too high then the Gulab Jamuns will tend to break. So adjust the temperature to ensure that the Gulab Jamuns do not break or cook too quickly.
14. The balls must be fried very slowly under medium temperatures. This will ensure complete cooking from inside and even browning
Sugar Syrup:
1. The syrup should be made earlier and kept warm.
2. To make the hot sugar syrup add mix the 2 cups of sugar to 1 cup of water.
3. Add 4-5 cardamom pods, slightly crushed and a few strands of 'Kesar'
4. Mix with a spoon and then heat at medium heat for 5-10 minutes until sugar is all dissolved in water.
5. Do not overheat, that will caramelize the sugar.
6. Transfer this hot syrup into a serving dish. Keep warm on stove.
7. Add the fried Gulab Jamuns directly into the warm syrup.
8. Leave Gulab Jamun balls in sugar syrup overnight for best results.
Rasa Malai

For malai
1. Milk - 4 cups
2. Lemon juice dissolved in water - 2
3. Maida - 1 tablespoon
4. Sugar - 1 1/2 cup
5. Water - 4 cups
6. Cardamom powder - 1/4 teaspoo
For ras
1. Milk - 3 cups
2. Sugar - 1 1/4 cup
3. Sliced almonds - 1 Table Spoon
4. Pistachios - 1 tablespoon
5. Cardamom powder - 1 teaspoon

1. Heat milk in a pan and bring it to boil for about 8-10 minutes.
2. When it starts boiling, add lemon juice and wait for the milk to curdle completely.
3. Remove from the heat and let it cool for about 3-5 minutes.
4. Pour over a thin muslin/cotton cloth and tie it with a tight knot. On straining this milk, the curd is obtained is called “Paneer”. Wash Paneer well using muslin cloth under cold running water to remove lemon juice flavor.
5. Knead Paneer for about 5-7 minutes to make smooth dough.
6. Make round shape flat balls and keep aside.
7. Next make sugar syrup. Mix sugar, water and cardamom powder in a saucepan and bring it to boil.
8. Add Paneer balls to the hot syrup on a medium heat and cook for about 15-20 minutes with lid partially covered.
9. Remove the Paneer malai from the sugar syrup carefully and let it cool.
Recipe for Ras (the ras malai syrup)
1. Add milk in a saucepan and bring it to boil. Boil this on over low flame for about 10-12 minutes.
2. Now add sugar, cardamom powder and bring it to boil for about 3-5 minutes.
3. Keep on stirring continuously, until it is reduced to thick consistency.(It should be reduced to 2 cups of milk).
4. Let the milk cool down for about 3 minutes. Then add malais one by one to the milk mixture and garnish with almonds and pistachios.
5. Refrigerate for about 6-8 hours.
6. Serve chilled.

Milk - 2 liters
Sugar - 1 cup
crushed Cardamoms - 8-10
Almond - 5 (chopped)
pistachios - 10 (roughly chopped)
Saffron

1. Boil the milk in a Kadai.
2. Keep stirring constantly and reduce it till it becomes thick and the quantity of the milk is approximately half a liter.
3. Remove from the flame and keep aside.
4. Add the sugar and cook for another 10 minutes.
5. Stir the mixture occasionally.
6. Remove from the fire.
7. Transfer to a bowl and add the cardamoms and the nuts.mix thoroughly.
8. Serve hot or cold.
Jack Fruit Halwa

Panasa tonalu (Jack fruit) - 20 – 25
ghee - 100gms
cashew nuts - 20gms
sugar - 100gms

1. Remove seeds from jackfruit and grind to paste, keep aside
2. Heat oil in a Kadai and heat ghee and add cashew nuts and fry till golden color
3. Add jack fruit paste and fry for few more minutes
4. Finally add sugar and mix well till the sugar dissolves
5. The delicious and yummy Jack Fruit halwa is ready to serve
6. Cool it and serve.
Dry Fruit Kheer

Almonds - 10 pieces (Separately soaked)
Cashews - 10 pieces (Separately soaked)
Gasagasalu - 1 Table Spoon (Separately soaked)
Pista - 10 pieces (Separately soaked)
Milk - 1 liter
Sugar - 1 ½ cup
Saffron - soaked in warm water
Elachi Powder - 1 Tea Spoon

1. Peel off the outer skin of the almonds and pistas
2. Grind all the dry fruits including Gasagasalu together in to smooth paste
3. Take a vessel and boil the milk in it until it reduced to ¾ of it
4. Add the fry fruit paste to it and boil again till it blends well
5. Simmer the flame and add sugar to it
6. Stir continuously till the sugar dissolves in it completely
7. Take off the vessel from heat and add soaked saffron
8. Allow it to cool
9. Delicious dry fruit kheer is ready to serve
10. Take it in to serving bowl and serve
